channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water seepage in middle of road after road resurfacing right in front of 124 Eden Way, 19th December
item.description:
After recent road resurfacing, I noticed water seepage in the middle of road in front of address provided. I noticed this during and after the resurfacing of road. Hope you will take immediate action to prevent it developing into a porthole. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Way, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree - Hoblingwell PROW FP152, 19th December
item.description:
A large tree has fallen and is currently blocking the footpath - PROW FP152 - between Leesons Way and St Paul's Wood Hill. It has also caught branches on other trees on the way down. Members of Friends of Hoblingwell plan to remove some smaller branches to help partially clear the footpath. Please could the tree team take care of the larger branches, etc.?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Paul's Wood Hill, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Filthy bins and fly tipping, 19th December
item.description:
My children attend Harris Primary Academy and have to walk past these dirty bins most mornings, which are always piled up With rubbish or have been attacked by foxes, leaving rubbish strew all over the street. Can they be moved or be cleared before school starts at 8:30AM please? The bins are at the corner of Whateley Road and Landcroft Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Whateley Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bed parts dumped, 19th December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Churchbury Road, Eltham

item.description:

item.title: Reporting same issue re inappropriate placement of public rubbish bin on Seven Sisters Road in front of HSBC Bank - although marked fixed. Please move to the side., 19th December
item.description:
Please dont mark as fixed when clearly it has not. This rubbish bin is still in the middle of the pavement, blocking foot traffic, making it dangerous for people walking, etc but also affects the image of the neighbourhood with litter everywhere.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Seven Sisters Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip black bags dumped, as a result the animals have opened up some others and a spread it around, 19th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Poverest, Greater London

item.title: Near kerbside and lampost, in between the boundaries of 23 Warren Street, and the adjacent building of 45 Fitzroy Street, 19th December
item.description:
Broken and multiple cracked paving slabs with some lifting. A repair had recently been carried out another broken slab, but the multiple broken slabs were the most in need of repair. Unfortunately, the portal will not allow photographs to be uploaded because of an error.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Warren Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London
